summary: Entrepreneur, speaker, ideator & thinker bringing the fractional & decentralized leadership model into the future of work. I‚Äôm a Fractional Futurist, helping fractional executives build million-dollar firms they can scale and eventually exit. Going from 0‚Äì1 is hard. Shifting from freelancer to founder is harder. That‚Äôs where I come in‚Äîwith strategy, structure, and the FROST Framework. I‚Äôm the co-founder of yorCMO, the first decentralized leadership franchise for fractional CMOs. And now, I‚Äôm scaling FractionalPros.com, a platform that connects SMBs with vetted fractional leaders‚Äîand helps those leaders find visibility, leads, and community through niche-driven peer pods. I believe in decentralized teams, strategic clarity, and the idea that every expert deserves a business model that works for them, not just because of them. I‚Äôve had a non-linear career and life. I‚Äôve: - Started a lawn care service in high school and sold the business before college - Studied and worked in chemical engineering - Founded 4 companies: from mortgage financing to media to data haptics tech - Published and written a book on media habits - Taught Entrepreneurship to university students - Created a documentary film on the seasons of entrepreneurship - Launched a community for fractional pros I spent years attempting to reconcile my wildly diverse experiences, let alone trying to explain them to those around me. Eventually, I realized that my decentralized nature was an asset: I could help other entrepreneurs engineer non-traditional, weird, unexpected and creative ideas into their businesses. Often it‚Äôs the simplest ideas that have the power to make a big impact & combust at scale. Board Member at Entrepreneurs‚Äô Organization (EO) Nebraska. I am also the host of a weekly podcast ‚ÄúThe Fractional C-Suite Retreat‚Äù featuring thought leaders on the future of work in the C-Suite. By day, professional tea and coffee drinker; by night, cigar enthusiast and living my best life with my wife and 4 children. headline: Business Consultant | The New Art of Living
summary: My journey's been quite a ride: from an Army brat to Military Police, then a police officer, paramedic, Navy spouse, and a business owner for 30 years. All those experiences gave me a unique lens for navigating life's big challenges. And my military dad? He taught me that your word is everything, period. That's always been my North Star. Then came the moment that changed everything. After my husband, Jim, passed away, I found myself in a really vulnerable spot, something I never expected despite my business success. That feeling was a huge wake-up call. I just refused to let anyone else go through that, so I dug in and mastered how to build lasting stability and well-being. My friends say I'm stubborn about everything, and hey, they're not wrong! For over 20 years, I've had the incredible privilege of helping hundreds of families and thousands of folks become their most resilient selves. My passion is empowering the people who truly keep our country going‚Äîveterans, folks in rural America, farmers, truckers, and entrepreneurs. I love taking complicated stuff and making it simple, helping people really step into their power. My approach is pretty straightforward: think strategically, make smart choices, and use what you've got effectively. My biggest tip? Consistent, focused effort really does pay off big time in the long run. With six generations of military service in my family, helping those who've served is deeply personal for me. And living out here in rural America, I'm constantly working to help our communities find their footing and build a strong future, generation after generation. You know that saying, "you are who you spend time with"? That totally changed how I connect with people. I love bringing clients, experts, and executives together because I really get what makes them tick‚Äîtheir challenges, their dreams, all of it. When I'm not busy helping people create brighter futures, you'll find me on my farm, training horses and dogs. Oh, and get this: at 60, I'm on zero meds and can deadlift almost 300 pounds! It just goes to show you that the same rules apply whether you're building a strong life or a strong body: ditch what doesn't serve you, stay consistent, and nail the basics. That... is the new art of living.

headline: Best Selling Author, Keynote Speaker, Top Executive Coach, Award-winning Global Leadership Thinker.
summary: Maya Hu-Chan is an award-winning keynote speaker, Top executive coach, best selling author and leadership educator. She is the founder and president of Global Leadership Associates, an international management consulting firm in San Diego, California. Maya has built a reputation for excellence in global leadership, cross-cultural management, diversity, equity and inclusion. Maya's latest book "Saving Face: How to Preserve Dignity and Build Trust" is Amazon #1 Best Seller (2020 Berrett-Koehler). Her book ‚ÄúGlobal Leadership: The Next Generation‚Äù was chosen by Harvard Business School's Working Knowledge book. She is a contributing author of 14 business books, and columnist for INC.com. Maya was ranked Top Leadership Coaches (2021-22), Top Global Solutions Thinkers by Thinkers50, World's Top 30 Leadership Gurus, Top 100 Thought Leaders in Management & Leadership, Marquis Who's Who in America 2025, and member of Marshall Goldsmith's 100 Coaches. Her charismatic and engaging style has made her a regular keynote speaker. She has lectured at The Brookings Institution, the University of Southern California, Penn State University, The University of Chicago, Dartmouth College and the University of California, San Diego. Born and raised in Taiwan, Maya received her BA in journalism and business from National Chengchi University. She was an anchor for the China Broadcasting Company, then moved to the U.S. to earn a MA from The University of Pennsylvania‚Äôs Annenberg School for Communication. summary: Once you realize that working with a coach elevates your game, you‚Äôll ask yourself what kept you from getting started sooner. Executive leaders in global organizations work with me because they know that by identifying, addressing, and minimizing the Culture Gap they get better at what they do. International frustration slows, their business growths, success shows. Ready to talk? üì© GetStarted@TheCultureMastery.com German by birth, American by choice, and Bavarian at heart, I am a fan of building bridges - across cultures - and not enthusiastic about walls. My clients know that "soft skills" are, in fact, hard. They come to us because they want to develop their ACE-Q (=AQ+CQ+EQ). I am a coach to executive global leaders and a cross-cultural consultant. People book me as a keynote speaker for international events. I am an experienced program facilitator, certified to work with the GlobeSmart Profile, the Inclusive Behaviors Inventory, the AQai assessment, and the CodeBreaker.BANKcode personality profile. I am also an NLP Master trainer. With my team at The Culture Mastery I help leaders close cultural gaps. Does your organization always meet its global growth goals? Without a solid foundation of cultural competence companies leave money on the table of international business. For more than a decade our clients have experienced measurable improvements and outrank their competition when it comes to structuring, leading, and communicating across cultures. I am a strong believer that any conflict can be resolved with a better understanding of our cultures. And as a German, burdened with the inherited guilt of the most horrific crime against humanity, it is my duty and moral obligation to make our world a more peaceful, responsible place. Our cultural training and coaching programs can be designed specifically for business leaders and thought leaders, as well as peace makers and rule makers. At The Culture Mastery we help people to work better together across cultures. When companies work internationally, their employees need to be effective in collaborating with people from cultures which are foreign to them. They need to be able to sell and market to customers with unfamiliar consumption preferences. Failing to communicate, manage, inspire, and lead across cultural differences is a huge risk for these companies, and the lack of cultural competence can be a bottom-line relevant issue.

headline: CEO | Founding Partner | Podcast & YouTube Host: The Future of Teamwork | Ecosystem Connector | Team Sense-Maker | Rugby Coach | Boundary Rider
summary: Over the years, I‚Äôve learned that the decisions we make as leaders ripple far beyond the boardroom. They shape careers, cultures, and communities... and, perhaps most importantly, they set an example for the people watching us most closely ‚Äî at work, and at home. I‚Äôve worn many hats: CEO, operating executive, advisor, dealmaker, coach, and podcast host. I‚Äôve led sales from $400 million to over $1 billion in an organic growth cycle, delivered 4x growth in six years, navigated more than a dozen acquisitions, and opened new markets. I‚Äôve worked in public companies, private equity-backed businesses, and family-owned enterprises in the middle of steep growth curves. The scale changes, but the through-line is always the same: connect great people, align them around a shared purpose, and give them the space to do their best work. That belief fuels my work at LEAD3R and as host of The Future of Teamwork Podcast, where I‚Äôve interviewed more than 150 leaders from every corner of the working world. Each conversation is a masterclass in leadership - part learning, part teaching, always a reminder that kindness and clarity are not mutually exclusive in high performance. These dialogues sharpen my own leadership style, helping me find new ways to guide teams that are both values-driven and results-focused. I‚Äôm endlessly fascinated by the changing shape of tomorrow‚Äôs workplace - how technology, community, and business can intersect to tackle big challenges like diversity and inclusion, skills transfer, innovation, and disruption. It‚Äôs a space where curiosity is an asset, and collaboration is both art and science. At this point in my career, I know two things for certain: great teams don‚Äôt happen by accident, and leadership is a privilege that comes with a responsibility to use it well. If you‚Äôre as interested in building purposeful teams and unlocking the potential of people as I am, I‚Äôd be glad to connect.

headline: Global Speaker * M&A Whisperer * #1 M&A Speaker/Consultant * HBR & Forbes Contributor * Author * MG100 * TEDx Speaker * Parkinson‚Äôs Caregiver
summary: If you are a CEO, entrepreneur or business owner pursuing mergers or acquisitions as part of your growth strategy, let‚Äôs talk. There‚Äôs a reason CEO's call me an "M&A Whisperer". The title comes from my work advising leaders and organizations on the "unexpected people challenges" of Mergers & Acquisitions. The challenges that can doom a deal but which rarely get covered in M&A preparedness training. I've been on all sides of the deal equation and show leaders what it takes to lead people through change and uncertainty. My leadership lessons came as an international C-Suite executive leading teams through three separate multibillion-dollar deals. I learned firsthand that M&A growth strategies suffer when leaders haven‚Äôt been prepared to guide their teams through the emotional roller-coaster that can occur post-deal. No wonder people struggle to pivot and adapt as quickly as management expects. These insights and lessons were captured in my best-selling M&A business book, "NOW WHAT? A Survivor‚Äôs Guide for Thriving Through Mergers & Acquisitions" which serves as a playbook for executives and handbook for frontline leaders balancing their day job with post-deal integration work. My M&A consultancy, Day1 Ready was founded on the premise that M is for Mindset and A is for Agile. Through one-day workshops and keynotes, I‚Äôve prepared hundreds of CEOs, executives and middle managers to recognize that success in M&A is not solely achieved by following static playbooks; success comes from having an adaptive mindset and an agile approach. Speaking on human capital strategies that drive M&A success, I‚Äôve guest lectured at the University of Chicago/Booth School of Business, Northwestern, and Thunderbird School of Global Management. I write a business leadership column for Forbes and contribute to Harvard Business Review, Fast Company, and Inc. Honored as Entrepreneur of the Year by Northshore Women in Business in 2019, I was recently ranked the #1 M&A Leadership Consultant by Leadership Research Institute and nominated to Thinkers50 2024 Radar list of future management thinkers to watch. Expertise: transition strategist; integration planning and execution; culture assimilation; change management; change communications; M&A on-boarding/off-boarding; brand identity and strategy; B2B marketing and communications Pursuing an M&A deal? Reach out to see how I might support you: Jennifer@jenniferjfondrevay.com

headline: I help owners build businesses they never want to sell. | We Buy Texas Businesses | $250M+ in Transactions | Author of ‚ÄòUnlocking Small Business Value‚Äô
summary: I'm not an exit consultant. I help owners build businesses they never want to sell. (Ironically, that's exactly when buyers pay the most.) Most 'succession advisors' are former brokers who've never written a check. I've written millions in checks. ‚úÖ Bought businesses with my own money and advised buyers and sellers in over $250 million worth of small business deals. ‚úÖ Learned how to systematize and grow businesses to not depend on their owners to operate (on my own dime!) ‚úÖ Sold businesses to strategic buyers ‚úÖ Structured management buyouts that actually worked ‚úÖ Helped owners pass to family without destroying relationships ‚úÖ Come from a real-world, dirty fingernails, operational background, not a consultant who only knows spreadsheets. That's why smart owners start succession preparation years before they need it. Not to sell. But to have the OPTION to sell. ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ WHERE ARE YOU? üî¥ TRAPPED: "I can't take a real vacation without chaos" ‚Üí We build systems so the business runs without you üü° GROWING: "I need to scale but organic growth is too slow" ‚Üí We acquire competitors or expand strategically üü¢ PREPARING: "I want options but don't know where to start" ‚Üí We create your succession roadmap (family, management, or sale) ‚ö™ READY: "It's time. Get me the best outcome possible" ‚Üí We run a process that adds 30-50% to your value ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ THE BOTTOM LINE: I don't push anyone toward a sale. headline: Building Powerful Strategies For Mission-Driven Companies
summary: Independent Strategy Advisor | Emerging Tech & Science Organizations ‚òè (301) 442-5889 ‚úâ mark@haasstrategy.com https://haasstrategy.com I help executives and boards of mission-focused and science-driven organizations make confident choices in environments of uncertainty and change. As Founder of Haas Strategy Solutions, I bring more than 40 years of management consulting experience across nonprofits, professional services, manufacturing, healthcare, defense, and emerging technology. My work complements internal planning by offering independent perspective, structured strategy processes, and an ethics lens that ensures decisions are resilient as well as ambitious. My career began in ecology and systems modeling, then expanded into public policy and decades of advising leaders at the National Institutes of Health, the U.S. Navy‚Äôs Office of Naval Research, international science programs, and economic development institutions such as the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development. Across these roles, I learned that organizations succeed or falter not only on technical brilliance, but on how well they align strategy, ecosystems, and ethics. That philosophy drives Haas Strategy Solutions today. My services focus on three core offerings: ‚Ä¢ Strategy Red Team ‚Äî an independent second opinion that surfaces blind spots, challenges assumptions, and tests resilience before major commitments are made. ‚Ä¢ Strategy Foundation ‚Äî a diagnostic and design process that clarifies mission, business model, and performance systems, giving leaders a stronger base for growth. ‚Ä¢ Strategy Stress Test ‚Äî scenario-based evaluation of resilience under disruption, whether from technology, regulation, competition, or economic shocks. I also advise organizations working at the frontier of emerging technology‚Äîincluding AI, quantum computing, biotech, defense, energy, and advanced manufacturing. I help translate technical roadmaps into organizational clarity: mapping ecosystems, planning for scarce talent, designing commercialization pathways, and embedding ethics and governance as strategic differentiators. For 20 years, I also served as an ethics officer, which taught me that foresight and trust are not optional. In fields from personalized medicine to AI, ignoring ethics until too late has slowed adoption and triggered regulation. By contrast, organizations that anticipate these issues build legitimacy faster and endure longer.

Today, I partner primarily with organizations to design programs and facilitate engagement that builds confidence and competence, capacity and connection. headline: Growing company value, exit planning, M&A advisory services, investor and board member
summary: With my background of owning companies for over 35-years as well as investing in and selling business I have owned I have learned great lessons as a CPA, CFO and CEO. This firm was created to leverage my prior experience to assist business owners as a long-term trusted advisor in the business financial arena. My passion is coaching business leaders to grow revenue, margin, profit, cash flow and ultimately the value of their companies. Whether this is for a 120-year-old multi-generational family legacy company or a startup with a great idea and in need of capital, I serve the gap between the owners, CEO and finance team. I have expertise in growing companies, preparing them for a sale transition and walking them through the process of the sale. I also provide guidance with obtaining capital and optimal debt structure. During my career I have worked with hundreds of business enterprises and provided counsel to buyers and sellers of companies to maximize the value and resulting after tax cash. My passion in working with business owners has been the culmination of preparing the business for sale and successfully transitioning the ownership, with the rewards optimized for the seller. Exit Planning strategy and M&A execution are also areas of my expertise. I bring my experience in board rooms as an active and engaged board member for a select group of companies.

headline: Leadership Culture Consultant & Keynote Speaker | Building Cultures Where We Replace ME-pathy with EM-pathy ‚Üí To Build High-Trust, High-Performance Teams
summary: Leadership wasn‚Äôt built for a people-first focus. It‚Äôs time to re-engineer it. I help executives and organizations transform empathy from being seen as a ‚Äúsoft skill‚Äù into a strategic leadership advantage. Using my ROE (Return on Empathy) framework, I turn Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) into Key People Indicators ‚Äì strengthening trust, accelerating decision-making, and improving business outcomes. The truth is, organizations rarely fail for lack of strategy; they struggle because people don‚Äôt feel safe, seen, or supported. Most leaders default to ME-pathy (‚Äúunderstand me, my intent, my stress‚Äù) without realizing it. True EM-pathy (‚Äúlet me understand you first‚Äù) drives psychological safety, retention, engagement, and innovation. My Mission To prove, with data and lived experience, that ROE is the new ROI. My Journey & Expertise I began life with a lesson in belonging -- adopted at three weeks old by parents who taught me worthiness, compassion, and unconditional love. Then came male-saturated industries where those traits weren‚Äôt always valued. I watched brilliant people burn out, values get compromised, and leaders rewarded for bureaucracy over bravery. I led that way once, too ‚Ä¶ until it backfired. My breakdown became my breakthrough. What I Offer EQ Assessment + Debrief A science-backed evaluation of baseline emotional intelligence across four key areas-Self-Awareness, Self-Management, Social Awareness & Relationship Management culminating in a personalized EQ Call to ACTion that becomes each leader‚Äôs roadmap for growth. Culture Consulting (ROE Framework) My signature Return on Empathy (ROE) methodology transforms organizational culture by shifting leaders from ME-pathy to EM-pathy, strengthening psychological safety, trust and communication across all levels within your organization. Keynotes That Create a Bias for Action Dynamic, evidenced-base talks on EQ, empathy, psychological safety and trust‚Äîshowing leaders how to make People FIRST = Performance ALWAYS. Track Record - Creator of the ROE (Return on Empathy) model and International Best Selling Author - Global keynote speaker on empathy, EQ psychological safety (U.S., Africa, Europe, SE Asia) - 25+ years leading teams in engineering, construction & high-risk government projects - Leading organizations from accidental to intentional cultures, rooted in their values and aligned with their vision. - Sparring partner for leaders across STEM, Operations and Federal Government Ready to turn empathy into your next strategic advantage? Book a call üìû with me today!

summary: As a business owner, you‚Äôre often pulled in too many directions, leaving crucial operational challenges on the back burner. That‚Äôs where I come in. As a Fractional COO, I step in to solve the pressing problems you don‚Äôt have the time to address‚Äîwhether it‚Äôs improving efficiency, reducing turnover, or preparing for major growth. My goal is to take the operational load off your shoulders so you can focus on what matters most: driving your business forward. WHAT IS A FRACTIONAL COO? A Fractional COO is an experienced Chief Operating Officer who works with your business on a part-time or project basis. You get the expertise of a full-time COO without the overhead costs. I step in to manage your operations, streamline your processes, and tackle the day-to-day challenges that you simply don‚Äôt have time for. From optimizing systems to improving profitability, I ensure your business runs smoothly so you can focus on growth. HOW I HELP YOU! Operational Problem-Solving: I specialize in taking care of the crucial issues that often get overlooked, from inefficiencies in your business to implementing systems that save time and money. Mergers & Acquisitions (M&A): If you're looking to grow through acquisitions or prepare your business for sale, I provide comprehensive guidance on sourcing deals, managing transactions, and integrating operations. Strategic Growth: Whether scaling a franchise from one to multiple locations or growing market share for real estate brokerages, I create tailored strategies to fuel sustainable growth. WHAT SETS ME APART: I understand that running a business is stressful, and I approach my clients with an empathetic, non-judgmental attitude. summary: I am a practical strategist, leadership coach, author, and professor working at the intersection of faith and real-world impact. company_description: Welcome to the Crowell School of Business where we provide a distinctive approach to business leadership. We call it Business as Ministry. Why is this important? Because business touches every area of contemporary life from the latest products to essential services, and we can‚Äôt live without the benefits today‚Äôs companies provide. But we regularly read about corporations or even whole industries that seem to stumble from one ethics-related crisis to another. We see failures of leadership at once-trusted brands that cast doubt on pursuing business as a career. Can business be conducted in a way that benefits society, builds profitable and sustainable companies, and is consistent with Christian faith? At the Crowell School of Business our faculty believes that business may be one of the most impactful career choices available for lives of service today. Whether in a public or private company, for profit or non-profit, known brand or entrepreneurial start up, the knowledge and skills you gain at the Crowell School will be valuable for a lifetime of impact. Why are we uniquely positioned to provide this distinctive approach to business leadership? Because the Crowell School faculty along with the other five schools at Biola University take the integration of faith and knowledge seriously as it applies to business, theology, the arts and sciences, humanities and more. Few business schools work so intentionally to pull from various academic and spiritual disciplines to equip students for lives of significance and impact. At Crowell, business education is designed so you learn and put into practice career-relevant business skills while engaging your faith and launching your career. We invite you to learn more about our School and programs by following us on LinkedIn and going to our web page. Or even better: come by and visit us some time!

headline: Business Strategist | AI Roadmap Builder | Sustainability Maven | Funding Strategist | Technology Futurist | Public Speaker
summary: You know how hard it is to buy fresh food at reasonable prices year-round that hasn‚Äôt travelled thousands of miles and arrived at the grocery store still ‚Äúgreen‚Äù? Nearly 19 million people in the US live in ‚Äúfood deserts‚Äù, meaning they don‚Äôt live near a grocery store. It‚Äôs not just lower-income folks that struggle. Big cities like LA and NY and Chicago have trouble providing fresh food to its citizens. I work with architects, engineers, farmers, and city planners to create buildings that come alive and are a source of food for the people that live there. There tends to be a struggle between architects, engineers, and city planners to develop indoor farms that meet strict building codes, are architecturally attractive, and can grow the foods that people want to eat. Growing thousands of plants indoors with these building restrictions quickly complicate the project. The people that are involved in these projects have specialized knowledge, like a musician in a symphony. They are experts at their instrument and look to the Conductor to provide guidance on when and how to play so that the music is played beautifully for the audience. I‚Äôm like the conductor when it comes to these big projects. I can ‚Äúsee‚Äù how, when, and where, the players need to bring their specialized knowledge to create the building that grows the food desired by the audience (in this case, the people that live in the city). Conductors know when certain instrument need to play louder, softer, and not at all. As the conductor, I know when to engage the engineers, architects, farmers, city planners and funders. When people work with me, they know they are an integral part of the team and how their role fits into production. More important, they can focus on bringing their specialized skills and talents to the project, free from the stresses of micromanaging components that don‚Äôt excite them or detract from what they love working on. What kind of food sustainability projects are you trying to build? I'd love to listen and see how I can support your efforts.

job_description: At Bold Accountability & Transformation (BAT), I am dedicated to empowering individuals and organizations through meaningful, life-affirming change. BAT's mission is to drive success, redefine professionalism, and cultivate inclusive cultures with innovative and participatory approaches. Services: Accountability Coaching: I offer tailored coaching to help you set and achieve your goals. Whether through individual coaching, group sessions, or writing workshops, I support you in maintaining focus and reaching your personal and professional milestones. Culture Consulting: Culture Consulting services are designed to foster inclusive and equitable environments within organizations. I offer DEI training and workshops, culture mapping and change navigation, participatory assessments and evaluations, and inclusive leadership coaching. My participatory approach ensures that solutions are rooted in your organization‚Äôs unique experiences and insights, guiding you through meaningful cultural transformation with authenticity and impact. Approach: I believe in a participatory approach that involves you in the process, ensuring solutions are grounded in your experiences and insights. Our work is rooted in authenticity, inclusivity, and a commitment to challenging the status quo. I pride myself on being a professional troublemaker and positive disruptor, dedicated to making a meaningful impact. Join me on a journey of transformation where your success and well-being are our top priorities. Let‚Äôs redefine professionalism together and build a culture that values diversity, equity, and inclusion.

summary: At Plum Leadership Group, we believe in the power of transformative leadership. With a focus on developing leaders and reshaping teams, our customized solutions are designed for lasting impact. Our approach is built on a foundation of executive coaching, strategic HR consulting, and a collaborative ethos that empowers every organization we touch. Leading with emotional intelligence and a partnership mindset, our team's mission is to simplify the complexities of leadership, ensuring every client's organizational and professional goals are not only understood but achieved.

job_description: Plum Leadership Group is dedicated to developing people leaders and strengthening teams through practical, customized solutions that deliver measurable growth. Our expertise is in manager training and development, ensuring organizations invest in the most influential leaders in their workplace, their frontline managers. We design and deliver a full suite of services, including leadership development programs, keynote speaking, executive coaching, consulting, and assessments. Each offering is tailored to address the unique challenges and goals of individuals, teams, and organizations. Our focus is on building leaders who can inspire, navigate complexity, and foster environments of trust and accountability. We partner with organizations to transform teams into high-performing groups that operate with clarity, alignment, and purpose. Whether through manager training cohorts, personalized coaching, team development workshops, or leadership assessments, our approach creates lasting impact and sustainable results. Our mission is simple: Developing leaders. Transforming teams.
company_description: At Plum Leadership Group, we help leaders, teams, and organizations achieve remarkable results through tailored leadership development, manager training, executive coaching, and impactful training programs. Our mission is to unlock potential, accelerate growth, and drive success at every level. We understand that great leadership starts from within. That's why our approach is rooted in self-awareness, emotional intelligence, and purpose-driven action. Whether you're looking to enhance team collaboration, improve organizational performance, advance your career, or gain clarity and confidence as a leader, we partner closely with you to achieve your most important goals. Our customized solutions begin with understanding your unique challenges and opportunities. From comprehensive leadership programs and dynamic team-building workshops to targeted coaching sessions and insightful psychometric assessments, we deliver sustainable results tailored to your needs. headline: CEO, Boston Institute for Meaningful Purpose. Igniting the power of meaningful purpose as a force for transformation.
summary: ‚Ä¢ What is the meaning of life? ‚Ä¢ You are living life as if what is its meaning? ‚Ä¢ Do you know why you are here and for what purpose? ‚Ä¢ How do you measure your life? ‚Ä¢ Are you satisfied with the quality of your life? It all started with a paradox. Years ago, I went through a difficult period asking myself precisely the questions above. Searching for answers, I discovered that others shared my concerns. As I described it in my first book, I faced a paradox: "Humanity does not suffer from a lack of answers; rather, it suffers despite the answers being available." This paradox became the central quest that led to the start of a new school of psychology: meaningful purpose. Fortunately, I discovered the answers to these existential questions, solved the paradox, and built a practice to help people get the necessary remedies. The point? You, too, can deal with your own paradoxes and benefit by finding the answers to these existential questions. So, if you have big plans and have been giving your all ‚Ä¶ YET you are struggling with any of the following ‚Ä¶ ‚Ä¢ Resistance to your efforts to make a positive difference at work and in social settings. ‚Ä¢ Lack of Support preventing you from achieving your professional goals and life dreams. ‚Ä¢ Discouragement from trying to bring to life relationships that should thrive but don't. ‚Ä¢ Frustration that your contributions are not being acknowledged and appreciated. ‚Ä¢ Disappointment with people who are indifferent and unresponsive to your contributions, aspirations, and talent. ‚Ä¢ Exhaustion from investing in long hours at work for little to no appreciation. ‚Ä¢ Disappointed that your life lacks meaning and direction. But there is hope! The Boston Institute for Meaningful Purpose has something to end the pain. It is called "Meaning Analysis and Improvement." When you harness the "Meaning Analysis and Improvement" method, you will ‚Ä¶ ‚Ä¢ Deepen your self-understanding and of your surroundings. ‚Ä¢ Build your self-confidence. ‚Ä¢ Discover your strengths and confront your weaknesses courageously for self-improvement. ‚Ä¢ Discern what other's agendas and their motives are. ‚Ä¢ Know the "real" root cause of a problem or situation. ‚Ä¢ Understand what your options are and how to select the most promising one. Check my LinkedIn references to read what some of our happy clients say. I will be happy to meet you through Luis@bostonimp.com and www.bostonimp.com. Boston Institute for Meaningful Purpose. Discovering Life‚Äôs Answers.

company_description: The International Positive Psychology Association (IPPA) is a global membership organization of thousands of academics and educators, practitioners and clinicians, students, and others ‚Äì from over 70 countries worldwide. The field of positive psychology focuses on the study and practice of positive emotions and the strengths and virtues that make all individuals, institutions, and communities thrive. The field has seen hundreds of millions of dollars invested into research, the founding of scientific journals, creation of baccalaureate degrees and masters and Ph.D. programs at universities, TEDx Talks, and reports and cover stories in major news and media outlets worldwide (including Forbes, The Atlantic, The Washington Post, The Guardian, Time Magazine, Parents Magazine, Wall Street Journal, Newsweek, U.S. News & World Report, and more). In addition, award-winning books and publications on both the science and practice of positive psychology have been released through publishing houses including McGraw-Hill, Wiley, Simon & Schuster, Penguin, and others ‚Äì increasing global exposure and prominence. IPPA's three-part mission is: - To promote the science of positive psychology and its research-based applications. - To facilitate collaboration among researchers, teachers, students, and practitioners of positive psychology around the world and across academic disciplines. - To share the findings of positive psychology with the broadest possible audience. In all of these endeavors, IPPA works to create rigorous standards for positive psychology, so that the field always represents the very best levels of current knowledge. If you share in this mission and vision, we hope you will consider joining us.

headline: Nonprofit & Small Business Consultant & Coach
summary: Shannon Parris is an innovative management consultant who equips nonprofit leaders and entrepreneurs to realize their visions and achieve their goals. With a decade of experience, she is a pragmatic accountability partner and empathetic coach, helping clients protect their time. Whether they need to launch a new project or program, operationalize a strategy, or simplify a process, Shannon enables clients to boost their capacity and reach ambitious goals. Shannon is passionate about developing the next generation of nonprofit leaders and entrepreneurs. A former nonprofit program director and serial entrepreneur, she knows that the people who are closest to the work often understand it best. Her approach blends strategic insight with practical guidance to support underrepresented leaders transitioning into new roles. Shannon built her operations and strategy expertise through versatile professional experiences. At Omicelo Cares, she launched a business accelerator that helped over one hundred small business owners increase their revenue, make strategic decisions, and embrace their leadership roles. She previously worked at ACLU of Pennsylvania, indie craft fair I Made It! Market, and nonprofit resale boutique WearWoof. Shannon also serves on the Equal Opportunity Board in Ross Township, a neighborhood in North Pittsburgh, and she completed a term on the board of Handmade Arcade, a nonprofit that supports makers and creative entrepreneurs. As a Korean adoptee raised in a predominantly white community, Shannon has a unique perspective on privilege and equity. She is most passionate about working to dismantle systems of oppression and to advocate for and galvanize nonprofit leaders and entrepreneurs with marginalized identities.

In 2023, we developed Implement and installed an institution-scale prototype at a childcare facility in McKeesport, PA. The Picky Eaters characters are now being developed into cartoons, affectionately called ‚ÄúReal Kids,‚Äù which will live in a digital universe and help spread our message of connection and acceptance. At the heart of Real Kids International is a deep commitment to inclusion and empowerment. headline: Franchise Matchmaker | I uncover ‚ÄòBlue Ocean‚Äô franchises which are highly profitable, easy to set up and help you create financial freedom | Dozens of success stories, will you be next?
summary: I‚Äôm Keith Liscio, the Founder and President of Excelsior Franchise Center. My background and experience have uniquely prepared me to serve as a consultant and coach to prospective business owners considering an investment in a franchise system. My mission is to work with clients to winnow thousands of franchises down to a handful of good options, and ultimately the perfect business for them. I grew up in a series of small, family-run businesses ‚Äì everything from a dry-cleaning shop to a liquor store to a meat market/deli/bakery. After getting a degree in marketing from Villanova University (and later an MBA from the Wharton School) I turned my attention to the corporate world working at Fortune 500 Companies like Procter & Gamble, Nabisco, and Kraft. Eventually, I became an entrepreneur importing ceramics from Italy and then spending almost 20 years running my own Executive Recruiting firm. I was even employed by a couple of franchisees along the way, flipping burgers at McDonald‚Äôs in college and working at one of the Midwest‚Äôs leading offices for Management Recruiters International. If I‚Äôve learned anything along this journey it‚Äôs that running a business is NOT for everybody. Entrepreneurship is even tougher, taking long hours, expertise, commitment, and a high tolerance for risk. That said, business ownership can be incredibly fulfilling and offers many benefits in terms of work/life balance, financial rewards, and tax advantages. Best of all, being your own boss can be great. Really great. For many people, buying a franchise business can be the best way to become a business owner. You‚Äôre investing in an established system that‚Äôs already successful. You‚Äôre in business for yourself, but not by yourself. There are hundreds of options available allowing buyers to choose a business that capitalizes on their strengths and interests while accommodating their preferred working styles. Best of all, I know the GOOD franchises, can save you time and money, and there is no charge for my service. All my fees are paid from the marketing budgets of my franchise partners. If you‚Äôre serious about being in business, I can find one that will fit your needs. If you‚Äôd like to learn more, schedule some time on my calendar and I‚Äôd be happy to answer any questions you might have. Just click here: https://meetings.hubspot.com/keith-liscio

Our goal is for young Black males to discover teaching, then support them at every point on their path to and through the profession. We do this through direct programming and key partnerships. This is The Black Male Teacher Initiative. PreK- High School: In our I AM KING Program (IAK), we train and mentor Black male high school students to deliver social-emotional learning content to younger boys of color. College: Black male college students join our Fellowship in the summer, where they receive instructional support to teach middle school students. Fellows engage in Black male affinity groups during their experience. In the following school year, they have access to additional professional development and networking opportunities, including taking our Introduction to Education, Equity, and Identity course, taught online and accredited by the University of Massachusetts Lowell. He is Me pays for the course! Career: The Black Male Teacher Network is a virtual space for Black male teachers to connect, build community, and engage in identity-based professional development opportunities. Teachers are trained to facilitate affinity groups for their peers, college students, and high school students in our programs. Field-Building: The Building Black Male Teacher Pathways Summit convenes leaders in the education sector to reflect on their initiatives to inspire and support Black male teachers through collaboration. Our lifelong focus provides a clear pathway for Black males to become and remain teachers. As a result of our programs and partnerships, schools will recruit, retain, and retire more Black male teachers.

company_description: Welcome to Gwinnett County ‚Äî one of America's fastest-growing counties for the past 20 years. Our dynamic and exciting county combines the best of big-city living with the comforts of the suburbs. The county's population in 2000 was about 588,448 and we‚Äôve only continued to grow since then, with more than a million residents now calling our county home. Gwinnett has many advantages, beginning with its location and road system. The county is just 45 minutes from Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport and 30 minutes from downtown Atlanta. Thanks to this location, 80 percent of the U.S. population is within a two-hour flight. Georgia Highway 316 has been extended to Athens, reducing travel time to the University of Georgia to 25 minutes. Gwinnett's infrastructure includes more than 2,750 miles of roadways to provide excellent mobility for our residents. The County Administrator and County Attorney are appointed by the Board of Commissioners and serve at its pleasure. To implement the Board's policy directives, the County Administrator uses a management team consisting of members of his immediate staff and 15 department directors. The 15 departments that make up the executive side are Police Services, Fire and Emergency Services, Corrections, Child Advocacy and Juvenile Services, Communications, Support Services, Financial Services, Community Services, Human Resources, Information Technology Services, Law, Parks and Recreation, Planning and Development, Water Resources, and Transportation. Each department is run by a director who is charged with managing operations efficiently and effectively. In addition to the executive side of County government, certain services are provided through Constitutional officers and independent elected officials. These external offices are created by the Georgia Constitution or through state law. In Gwinnett, they include the Sheriff, Tax Commissioner, District Attorney, Probate Court Judge, and Chief Magistrate.

summary: I‚Äôm a business strategist, technology leader, and speaker who has spent nearly thirty years building, advising, and leading organizations that create measurable growth and meaningful impact. I‚Äôve built and led eight successful companies while also advising executives, business owners, and teams on strategic growth, technology integration, and operational excellence. I know what it takes to build something that lasts, and I bring that same focus and accountability to every project and partnership. As CEO and co-founder of Woos IT, I lead a team that supports companies nationwide with technology systems that are secure, efficient, and designed for scale. summary: I‚Äôve always believed that every difference‚Äîwhether in perspective, background, or approach‚Äîholds the potential for connection and transformation. Along the way, I‚Äôve had the privilege of partnering with organizations to foster inclusive, collaborative, and high-performing cultures that drive engagement, innovation, and sustainable success. My career is rooted in a simple yet powerful philosophy: resolving differences leads to redefining leadership. From navigating complex organizational challenges to coaching executives, my work is guided by a structured process I call the Reconciliation Method‚Ñ¢. This approach bridges diverse perspectives into cohesive strategies, delivering solutions that are not only actionable but authentically aligned with an organization‚Äôs values. Whether I‚Äôm facilitating cultural audits, optimizing team dynamics, or coaching leaders to connect their values with their actions, I aim to help organizations thrive by putting people at the heart of their success. Over the years, I‚Äôve led the design and global expansion of DEIB strategies, cultivated growth-oriented, human-centered cultures, and created frameworks for alignment that endure. My process is both data-driven and deeply empathetic, ensuring every recommendation is practical, sustainable, and meaningful. I specialize in leadership development, organizational alignment, and creating cultural transformation that sticks. When I‚Äôm not immersed in bridging gaps and aligning leadership values, you‚Äôll often find me exploring new cities, indulging in the rich history and local cuisine that each place has to offer. headline: Helping B2B leaders accelerate & de-risk organic growth while delivering results from new business, innovation and transformation. Let's make an impact!
summary: A recognized B2B growth expert and coach, I help B2B leaders accelerate & de-risk growth through strategic market innovation. CONTACT ME for a complimentary consultation at 216.333.4569 or Kelly@LawrenceInnovation.com. I'm the one people call to deliver new business growth. With over 20 years of experience spanning Fortune 500 companies, privately held businesses, and startups, I'm grateful to have partnered with global leaders and coached hundreds of team members to drive top and bottom-line growth while unlocking new business opportunities: strategy to execution. I strive for continuous learning, so it's an honor to serve as a contributing author to WhatTheyThink, an AIM Institute coach and Innoquest community member. I've enjoyed the learning that has come from authoring globally recognized market reports and working with global teams over the years. I am thrilled to share insights with others who share the vision of improving organic growth processes and results. When you choose to work with me, you gain a partner who cares about growing your business just as much as you do. Specializing in strategic market innovation, my boutique advisory firm helps B2B leaders de-risk and accelerate organic growth for long-term sustainable business results. My approach is recognized for delivering value-driven partnerships and measurable ROI. I am humbled that my clients who collectively represent over $120 billion in annual revenue, partner with me to solve real-world problems that make a significant impact. ORGANIC GROWTH EXPERTISE From initial market assessment through demand creation, I help you analyze your unique situation and develop practical action plans to accelerate organic growth. I also help teams build stronger competency in front-end-of innovation processes for higher hit rates. Before founding Lawrence Innovation, I delivered impactful innovation results at Fortune Brands' Moen and Berkshire Hathaway's Lubrizol. My teams typically have a hit rate upwards of 60% versus industry averages of under 5%. What would it do for you if you could improve your hit rate by 10x? MY VISION Walt Disney said, "If you dream it, you can do it." I say, of course you can, but make sure it matters to your customers before you build it. MAKING IT MATTER Passionate about making the world a better place, I live and play in Greater Cleveland, Ohio with my husband and two daughters - my why. I relish learning new things. Hobbies include traveling, standup paddle boarding, hiking with my pal Zeke (English Black Labrador), baking, & reading.

headline: Fractional CMO | Business Growth Advisor | Business Coach | Strategy & Marketing Expert | Helping Professional Services & Consumer Brands Scale, Differentiate & Win
summary: As a strategic advisor, coach, and consultant, I help business owners, founders, and managing partners simplify complexity, create clarity, and drive sustainable growth. I work with professional service firms, consumer product brands, manufacturing businesses, construction companies, and technology firms to develop and implement actionable strategies that fuel revenue growth, enhance profitability, and build high-performing teams. WHY MY EXPERIENCE MATTERS TO YOUR BUSINESS: I spent my career leading marketing, sales, and business development for well-known consumer brands and manufacturing firms. While my expertise began in consumer-driven industries, the principles of growth, positioning, and strategy apply universally and are just as critical for professional service firms as they are for consumer brands. Professional service firms struggle with differentiation, client acquisition, and scaling. Consumer brands focus on creating emotional connections, brand loyalty, and effective go-to-market strategies. My expertise blends both, helping professional service firms apply consumer-driven insights to win more business while guiding consumer brands to develop lasting market impact. HOW I HELP: ‚úî Growth Strategy & Positioning ‚Äì Establishing a compelling market position that drives demand and revenue. ‚úî Leadership & Team Optimization ‚Äì Helping owners develop leadership skills, structure strong teams, and build a results-driven culture. ‚úî Sales & Marketing Acceleration ‚Äì Driving lead generation, conversion, and long-term customer engagement. ‚úî Business Efficiency & Financial Strategy ‚Äì Identifying key operational efficiencies to improve profitability and scale effectively. ‚úî Exit & Transition Planning ‚Äì Preparing businesses for leadership transitions, mergers, or sales to maximize value. headline: Executive and Leadership Coach ‚ô¶ Leadership Team Coach ‚ô¶ Public Speaker and Facilitator ‚ô¶ Non-Profit Board Leader and Founder
summary: I'm Kat, a Finnish-American ICF-certified executive and leadership team coach, facilitator, and speaker with 25+ years of experience in global organizational and leadership development. I help leaders and organizations create a culture of inclusion and psychological safety where innovation thrives. My master‚Äôs degree in Mental Health Counseling informs my holistic, research-backed coaching framework. Together, we explore new perspectives and identify solutions for growth and success as well as health and well-being. In 1998, I moved from my native Finland to New York City. I was the first in my family to earn a college degree and, like many others, I craved the energy, inspiration, and diversity of life in NYC. I held career services and HR & development roles before founding my independent coaching practice. My expertise lies in international and highly-demanding professional contexts‚Äîsince founding my practice, my work has taken me to Helsinki, Rome, Bangkok, and Bonn and I‚Äôve worked with leaders based across six continents. Sisu‚Äîthe Finnish concept of resilience‚Äîand my own personal experiences as an immigrant have deeply influenced my coaching philosophy. My approach to coaching is built upon a core belief in our human capacity to learn and grow, to succeed through challenges, and live and lead with purpose. Alongside my coaching practice, I am an experienced senior non-profit founder and board leader. I have founded, led, and developed several global and local non-profit community organizations over the past 30 years. After I moved to NYC, I founded two non-profit organizations with and for Nordic women. I have served as vice-president for a global non-profit FIGT.org, and the local Finnish American Chamber of Commerce in NYC. I led the Chatham High School Marching Band Club, a registered 501c3, as President for several years. As a leader, I am driven by my values to make a difference by strengthening communities through engagement. In all my leadership experiences, I have improved the performance and structure of the board‚ÄîI am a skilled organizer known for getting things done. I lead with a strong vision and clear goals while building engagement and motivation through communication and relationship building. Want to learn more about working with me as your executive or team coach and facilitator? Send me a note!

headline: Business Architect | Operations Strategist | Transformation Agent | Startup Catalyst | Ethical Leader
summary: I'm a builder - businesses, teams, and yes, even the physical structures themselves back in the day. It started from the time I was a kid, when I developed a fascination with downtowns - the interesting collections of buildings right next to each other with so many diverse activities going on inside them. When I began to see my downtown emptying out, like so many others, I knew I wanted to be a part of saving it, rebuilding it, and bringing it back to life. At first I took that literally - going to school to study architecture and engineering to revitalize and repurpose historic buildings. Later, I realized that I could have an additional impact by being a part of getting new business energy into those spaces for revitalization and growth. Fast forward to today, I have a two-pronged approach to support business: guiding companies as they come into existence, and also advising business how to operate efficiently so they stay in existence. From Main Street businesses to Fortune 500 corporations, and from incubators/accelerators to economic development agencies, my clients have benefited from interacting with me and my teams for over a decade. In addition to a substantial library of operations know-how, key tools in my leadership toolbox are: actively listening to constituents and 360-degree awareness of everyone in the ecosystem; circumspection while clearly seeing all points of view; and optimizing a strategic win-win outcome that can be operationally executed by a balance of guidance and inclusion of all stakeholders. Contact me if you'd like to build (or re-build!) something great together.

headline: üíéKeynote Speaker & CALM Method‚Ñ¢ Creator | I help people rebuild trust and reconnect where it matters most‚Äîat home, at work, and under pressure | Award-winning author with 20+ years frontline experience
summary: Hi, I‚Äôm Carlamay Sheremata. I‚Äôm a retired police officer, keynote speaker, award-winning author, and family conflict resolution specialist‚Äîbut more than that, I‚Äôm a bridge-builder. Between systems and people. Between leaders and their teams. Between families and the youth they love. After 21 years in law enforcement‚Äîincluding 8.5 years as a School Resource Officer‚ÄîI‚Äôve seen what happens when people lose connection. I‚Äôve watched families fracture, leaders burn out, teams implode, and kids fall through the cracks. Not because people didn‚Äôt care‚Äîbut because they didn‚Äôt know how to lead through the hard stuff. That‚Äôs why I created the CALM Leadership Method‚Ñ¢‚Äîa trust-centered, emotionally intelligent approach to leadership that works in real life. Under pressure. In crisis. In the moments that matter most. I now help corporate teams, educators, frontline professionals, and families lead with connection, rebuild trust where it‚Äôs been lost, and communicate clearly when it counts most‚Äîat home, at work, and everywhere in between. Whether I‚Äôm on stage speaking to executives, equipping frontline teams, or sitting across from a family in conflict, I bring the same message: Connection heals what correction can‚Äôt. And if we don‚Äôt fix the disconnection, we lose the people who need us most. I‚Äôm also the author of the award-winning book Youth Truth: Engaging in Conversations That Can Change Lives‚Äîa raw, practical guide that equips parents, educators, and mentors to connect with today‚Äôs youth on the tough topics that matter most. It‚Äôs not just a book‚Äîit‚Äôs a bridge between generations, emotions, and relationships. Through real stories, bold truths, and actionable tools, I teach people how to lead with clarity, courage, and compassion‚Äîwithout burning out or checking out. Because when we get connection right, everything changes. What I Speak & Train On: Trust-Centered Leadership in High-Stress Environments The CALM Method‚Ñ¢: From Reactive to Regulated Leadership Building Emotionally Resilient Teams and Families The Bridge Between Home & Work: Leading from the Inside Out Youth Truth‚Ñ¢: Conversations That Reach Today‚Äôs Kids Being Pink in a Blue World: Leading Authentically in Male-Dominated Spaces Let‚Äôs connect if you‚Äôre: A leader ready to retain your people‚Äînot lose them A team burned out from constant crisis A parent, coach, or educator ready to build trust with youth An event planner looking for a speaker who brings heart, humor, and real talk A human who believes leadership starts with presence‚Äînot position Let‚Äôs rebuild trust where it matters most‚Äîtogether.

previous_job_description: Youth Truth: Engaging In Conversations That Can Change Lives üìñ Do you know what questions to ASK your kids, students, and the youth in your life to get them to talk with you? Wouldn‚Äôt it be great to have them actually respond and engage in conversation? It really is possible! In Youth Truth, you will discover how to approach the difficult topics that need to be talked about with your kids or students. You can do it with empathy and support. You can create safe spaces where youth feel valued and heard. Youth Truth can enhance your understanding of the issues that youth are dealing with these days. That way, you will know what the right questions are and the right way to ask the questions that actually touch hearts with the young people you want to reach. This gripping book delves into the raw, unfiltered world of today‚Äôs youth. Their lives are way more complex than most realize. It is a compelling and poignant exploration of the challenges faced by young souls, bringing to light the often overlooked and misunderstood battles they fight. From the haunting shadows of suicide to the insidious presence of bullying to the silent struggles of eating disorders and the desperate yearning just to be seen‚Äìthis narrative bares it all. It is a powerful testament to the resilience, strength, and untold stories of a generation yearning for understanding and compassion. More than just a collection of stories, the author, a retired law enforcement and school resource officer, delivers a call to action, emphasizing the critical need for open, honest, and compassionate conversations. Youth Truth highlights how listening and engaging in meaningful dialogue can profoundly impact the lives of young people.

company_description: Leaders in executive search and talent acquisition spend their days advising others, managing expectations, navigating pressure, and holding complex human dynamics. They are expected to be decisive, composed, and constantly available, often while absorbing stress from clients, candidates, partners, and teams. The challenge is not a lack of capability. It is the accumulation. The cost shows up as blurred priorities, reactive decision-making, leadership fatigue, and the quiet sense that there is no place to put the weight you are carrying. Leadership in talent and search can feel grounded, clear, and sustainable without losing edge, credibility, or performance. When we work together, leaders gain clearer judgment under pressure, greater confidence navigating client, candidate, and internal dynamics, and practical tools to manage complexity without constant reactivity. The result is steadiness that carries into teams, clients, and decisions. This work supports leaders who are already strong and want to lead with greater clarity, presence, and meaningful connection, particularly in complex, high-pressure environments. I have spent my career in executive search and talent acquisition. I understand the pace, the pressure, and the unspoken expectations that shape this work. My coaching blends leadership experience, talent expertise, and a structured, human-centered approach for leaders who do not need theory. They need clarity. I bring over two decades of experience working alongside senior leaders in executive search, recruiting, and people-driven organizations, including scaling and leading global search operations for a PE-backed talent advisory firm through organic and M&A growth. If this resonates with you or your team, I invite you to schedule a confidential conversation to explore whether coaching support would be useful right now.
